data.title: Food was good service was slow.
data.text: We decided to sit in the lounge area instead of the restaurant, same servers and they were not very busy. The food tasted good and was well prepared but the service was very slow.

data.title: Quick Lunch
data.text: The red pepper pesto melt was awesome it left me wanting more.  I grabbed a Snapple Ice Tea and it was only like $8.00.  Need to go back for the Buffalo Chicken melt!

data.title: Yummy!!
data.text: My grilled Mac & Cheese sandwich totally satisfied.  The bread was grilled to a perfect degree of crispness and the m&c burst with cheesy flavor and the right amount of squish without dripping.  I stumbled upon this eatery after wandering out of the food desert surrounding the convention center.  Order at the counter and wait only a few minutes to receive this manna from food heaven.

data.title: Good for a quick breakfast or lunch
data.text: We went there for breakfast with some friends.  The breakfast sandwiches are fresh and very good.  The service at the counter is excellent.  The space is bright and welcoming. I would definitely try the lunch menu.

data.title: Awesome grilled cheeses
data.text: This place was awesome quick and clean the food was awesome.  Fast and cheesy the tatie tots were the bomb.  The tomato soup was good too

data.title: Melts in your mouth
data.text: Sandwiches were all very good but you did not receive any sides with your sandwiches. The sandwiches were all prepared fresh and put into a nice box. Presentation was great.

data.title: Really great Grilled Cheese!
data.text: I love a good grilled cheese and this place did not disappoint.  I was greeted by a very guy named Neil and waited just a couple minutes for a really great grilled cheese with tomato.  The bread was perfect and the cheese has a great blend. I will go back!!

data.title: Counter help are rude, angry people, with no customer service skills
data.text:
I walked in smiling asking what was good and the young man behind the counter said "i don't know. What do you want?"

I  ordered a combo with decaf coffee and when I went to fill up the cup, the decaf looked like brown water. So I reported that there seemed to be a problem with the decaf and the counter person said " I don't know what you want me to do about that, it's, it's decaf?" So, I said, I want you to give me my money back on the coffee.

And he did. He never once looked at me, inferred any kind of apology and never said thanks for the business, even though I did purchase a sandwich.

Now, for the review of the food: 

You are heating up tater tots. They should actually be hot. Is that a hard thing to accomplish? I think it requires a hot oven. Does capitol melts have one of those?

You are serving breakfast sandwiches on english muffins. You should know something about english muffins, such as, they actually need to be cooked, before you put meat and cheese on them, otherwise, they are ostensibly raw bread with cooked food.

I can't imagine you will be there long, but if you are, good luck to you.

And tell your nasty young white male servers, that if they are going to be rude they should at least be serving good food.

Fondly,
A state street business owner

data.title: Nice place with potential
data.text:
Went up to Capitol Melts a little before lunchtime today and was able to walk right up to the counter.  The space is nicely decorated and well lit, taking up the lobby at 136 State Street.  There are currently 5 tables for seating inside.  My order was taken right away by the friendly staff.  I ordered the tomato bisque and a grilled cheese, tomato, and bacon on rye.  The order was ready in just a few minutes.

The soup was very good. Flavorful and a nice size.  I believe it was $3,95.  The sandwich was also very good.  The rye bread was fresh.  The tomato and bacon added nice flavor.

Overall, a nice lunch.  Need to work on reducing their packaging.  The grilled cheese came in a nice box with their logo but it is too big for just a sandwich.
